column5: We started out going down to the cottage in Long Point Saturday Morning to do some bass and pike fishing. It took us quite a while to get into some bass but couldn't find 1 pike. The bass were hitting out near Pottahawk and we managed about 10 fish. Nothing big just around the 12" to 14" mark.  After giving up trying to find pike we decided to head towards Port Rowan to check for some perch. We managed about 8 keepers but we had to head in for the night.  We decided the next morning to start off going for perch since the weather was looking very bad. We managed 62 keepers throwing about 20 back. Also had the usual sunfish and rockies. My buddy was able to catch a catfish with a live minnow 1 foot under the water in 10 feet. That was a first for us as you can tell from the pic. He is also the guy that managed to catch a sucker trolling for walleye.  We were off the water by noon because of how the weather was looking. It never got that bad but you really don't want it to out there.
Great Report!Looks like a nice feed! But alot of work!!! I tried cleaning a bunch of perch and stopped at about 8 and fed the rest to the cats.lol
It took both of us with a knife each an hour and 45 minutes to clean them. Well Worth it!

Wow, those storm clouds look really scary.  I'm surprised they didn't develop into something worse.  Good call getting off the water tho.  Nice mess of perch there.  Somebody's gonna be eatin good this week  Good report.  Joey
Great report and pics.  Those pics of the storm clouds were pretty cool!  Great job on the catching and cleaning...makes the cooking and eating all the better!
great report,the cloud pics are pretty wild
Long Point is such an awesome place-both for fishing and the scenery & beach.
Wow, picture #3 is incredible and you really captured the power of the approaching storm !!!!  Thanks for posting it.  Oh yeah, and a nice feed of perch too
Wow, that Perch table looks yummy! and even better in the bags - only thing missing was the hot pan!
